reviews.text: This was a stop over on the way to Florida. The room was large, reasonably priced, and included a refrigerator and microwave.
reviews.title: Clean & quiet

reviews.text: The hotel is only 3 years old and has been very well kept, so everything still looks brand new.
reviews.title: Great but with just a couple snafoos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk and breakfast staff were very friendly. And the hot breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel just needs a few adjustments

reviews.text: The only downfall was that two different gps units couldn't locate the hotel. We had to look for signs and ended up finding the actual address on a smart phone and putting that in the gps unit.
reviews.title: Less than I expected

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way back from Florida. It was more than suitable for crashing out for the night. Country Inn and Suites are generally good stays. We were, however, left with a tiny amount of toilet paper upon arrival, the wake up call service on the phone wasn't working, and there was a hanging bulb (not working) in the bathroom. The room was spacious...they gave us a handicapped room, which was just fine with us. :) We would stay here again if passing through.
reviews.title: What you would expect for the price

reviews.text: Very comfortable hotel in a new area business/industrial complex right off I-75 - the only close restaurant currently is the Waffle House but there are many others at the next exit north about 1.5 miles. Staff was wonderful and very accomodating. Everything was clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Nice and New

reviews.text: This is a brand new hotel on what looks like a brand new exit. It was WONDERFUL! We stayed there going to Orlando. We decided to split our trip going back to Nashville and made another reservation there!
reviews.title: So good we stayed there twice!

reviews.text: Very clean, great beds, nice large rooms. I would have been comfortable staying there even a few nights if needed, but VERY nice for an over night stay!
reviews.title: Very clean, nice place to stay. Highly recommend.

reviews.text: For directions...don't follow Google, just take Exit 99 :)
reviews.title: New large and clean rooms with poor customer service, false advertising, and needs lots of repair.

reviews.text: Stayed here while in town to ride the SAM Shortline Train (which is by the way a very good outing for couples, girlfriends weekend, families with school age kids). Hotel was a very good value -- a suite with separate living area for the price of a room at any other hotel. Facility and room were exceptionally clean. Located in an area where there is some construction, but that wasn't too much of a problem other than the entrance was being re-graded and dug up - still, we got in/out with no issues. Staff, especially the lady overseeing the breakfast, was friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good and has a decent variety. If you want more choice, there is a Cracker Barrel one exit north. For a free breakfast, the hotel's offering will more than suffice. I knew they were pet friendly prior to my visit, and while that wasn't preferable to me, I realize a number of travelers are looking for a place that is. I could hear a small dog barking at night, but it wasn't that excessive; the hotel met all of my other requirements (safe area, location, price, offering suites), so I was prepared to deal with the pet issue. There's a little "hall noise" at times, but again not that bothersome. Mostly, this can be heard from the livng area of the suite. We were on the side away from the interstate, so I can't say how the rooms on the interstate side are; but we sat out by the pool one evening and the while the hotel is close to the interstate, the traffic noise wasn't that loud. The parking lot is well lit and the area seemed reasonably safe for an interstate-side hotel. The hotel is kind of out to itself right now, but a new little strip shopping center is being developed just across the access road.
reviews.title: Best place in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Country Inn on our way through Georgia. We prebooked through the hotel website and were upgraded to a suite room without requesting it. We did ask for a room away from the interstate, based upon earlier reviews.
reviews.title: A great stay and a pleasant surprise!

reviews.text: The suite was large with two rooms. The first had a sofa bed, business desk and tv, and the second was a great king bed with another tv. It was so nice to have the 2nd tv as my hubby does not like DWTS!!
reviews.title: New but not great

reviews.text: The room was very clean, and had both a microwave, frig and coffee maker. The location right off the interstate was perfect for us as it was an easy access. The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, toast, waffles, juices, milk and coffee. We found it to be the best hotel included breakfast. The hotel was busy and they were refreshing the food when we arrived.
reviews.title: Pool and spa not working

reviews.text: The front desk people were professional, friendly and always had a smile! We would recommend this hotel and most likely will stay here on our next trip south!
reviews.title: WARNING WARNING WARNING

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in mid July '09. It was a nice new hotel but a very bad location. It basically butts right up to I-75 and if you have a room on the side facing the highway, like we did, then good luck getting a good nights sleep. The air conditioner is set up in a way that you cannot leave the fan on (to drown out the traffic noise) without turning off the air conditioning. I've had much more elaborate continental breakfasts at other hotels, there was not much to choose from at this one. Overall, if you get a room on the side not facing the highway and you don't care if there's not much choice in breakfast items then I'd say stay here. If not, stay somewhere else in Cordele.
reviews.title: Time to quit relying on the word
Nice inexpensive stay
reviews.text: This hotel was on our way to Florida for a wedding. The location was out of the way and nothing else was around it. We needed a suite for the 5 of us and it was reasonably priced and very large for our group. The breakfast was good, the same hotel type food , but adequate. I noticed some guests were using coupons, so when I mentioned them, I was given the regular room rate which really pleased me. The front desk was very helpful, and because of that we stayed at this same hotel on our way back to Indiana with only 3 people this trip and a coupon from the rest area. The hotel seemed to be pet friendly as I noticed some guests with their pets. The hotel is about 3 years old and good for a overnight stay.

I stayed here on a return trip from TN to FL. I had stayed at another Country Inn and Suites on the trip in Dalton GA. Both hotels were rated 2 1/2 stars, and I booked through Priceline. This one had a few minor issues. Overall, a good stay. The exterior, and lobby area was great, except there were no cookies at the coffee/cookie station. They did have them later in the evening.....very good....the coffee was excellent, too.
reviews.title: Another good place for a stop over....

reviews.text: Although there is only a Waffle House across the road, easy access to 75, and one exit north had tons of places to eat, and service stations. The area is quiet, except for the Freeway noise.
reviews.title: Nice/New Clean - but highway noise is intollerable

reviews.text: The room was clean, and large, on the 3rd floor. The guest directory was open on the desk....however, it was completely empty, except for the dividers, and some wrinkled envelopes, and a few sheets of wrinkled paper. There also was no TV channel listing to be found, the 32" had a good picture. The bath was of good size, and very clean. The bathroom sink faucet was a bit strange. It sprinkled out a small volume of water, with little pressure.....sort of like a kitchen sink sprayer, without the volume, and pressure. I checked under the sink to see it it had been turned off, but it was fully on. It also took a very long time for the water to get warm enough to comfortably wash up. Towels were big, and plentiful. The bathtub had a grab bar, but there was no wall mounted soap dish/shelf. Having a bad back, it was difficult to reach down for the shampoo and soap. There was a clock radio, where there wasn't one in Dalton.
reviews.title: Best hotel on I-75

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The PM, and AM desk clerks were efficient, and friendly. I was instantly given a TV channel listing, and kleenex when I asked. The breakfast room was very clean, and a good variety for food. The pastries were not individually wrapped as they were at the Dalton hotel, but . they had homemade muffins here...very good. There was no Managers Welcome Hour" like they had in Dalton.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Room was perfect
